subject: Re: And now for something completely different: The Way of Testivus
msgSnippet: ... Hi J.B., I think you are wonderful too, and a major asset and ally in our effort to get more developers to get more actively involved in testing their own
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains762@...> wrote:
...
> I should add to clarify my position that I think you're wonderful, I
> like you and I respect you, but I just dislike quite strongly the way
> you present these ideas. You're naturally free not to care about that,
> but I hope you continue to like and respect me, as I think you do.
>
> [More concisely: it wasn't a personal attack, so please don't take it
> that way.]
> --
> J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.ca
> ...

Hi J.B.,

I think you are wonderful too, and a major asset and ally in our
effort to get more developers to get more actively involved in testing
their own code.

>but I just dislike quite strongly the way
> you present these ideas.

Given how careful I've tried to be with my language this surprises me.
Other than the two mentions of dogma which I addressed in the
previous post, what other presentation of ideas do you dislike?
Please let me know because this kind of feedback is very useful.

As a matter of fact, thank you for taking the time to comment on it.
Testivus is meant to start discussions, not to end them :-).

Alberto
